casebody.data:
Albert Nolte, Respondent v. The Manhattan Railway Company, Appellant. Decided June 27, 1890. Appeal from judgment entered in favor of plaintiff upon the verdict of a jury, and from an order denying defendant’s motion for a new trial. Davies & Rapallo, for appéllant. Charles Steckler, for respondent.

Before Freedman and Truax, JJ.

The Court

held (Freedman, J., writing, Truax, J., concurring) that the judgment and order should be affirmed with costs.
